quest.name: Deus Eggs Machina
journal:
Jihli Aliapoh is like a coiled snake, ready to pounce on the next hidden egg.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

You and Jihli have succeeded in one egg hunt only to face another of Nonotta and Riggy's carefully constructed trials. This time, the map includes a baffling array of letters, almost entirely obscuring the diagram below, and the number of spriggan helpers has jumped from three to five. Whether the increased amount of information will aid or hinder your efforts remains to be seen as you set about quizzing Riggy's brethren.

※Please note that you will not be able to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, check the Lodestone.

As in the previous puzzle, the spriggans each reveal a numerical clue, although keeping track of the locations of all five may prove difficult without some form of writing apparatus. While you traverse the various clearings and groves of Old Gridania, Jihli attempts to solve the mysteries concealed in the map, and her astute observations may yet be the deciding factor in locating the egg.

Now that the necessary information has all been gathered, only the task of uncovering the location of the hidden egg remains. Nonotta informs you that the password is once again “Egg Hunt,” which is a small mercy considering that every other aspect of the puzzle has become more complex in comparison to the last one. Jihli appears to be ruminating on the relationship between the numbered spriggans and the letters on the map, and should you feel the need to ask, she would be more than glad to share her thoughts on the matter.

You and Jihli successfully deduce that the one in possession of the gilded topaz egg is Gabineaux, a prominent figure among the woodsmen of the Central Shroud. Upon hearing the password, he gladly hands over the prize in question, as instructed by Nonotta and Riggy, who both arrive almost immediately after. Despite being overjoyed that you and Jihli were eventually able to locate the egg, Riggy expresses his sadness at his role of master of puzzles coming to an end. Sensing that a new purpose in life may be exactly what the young spriggan needs, Gabineaux offers him a position among his apprentice lumberjacks─a proposal that is gleefully accepted. However, he still has one last duty to perform: overseeing the conclusion of the egg hunt at Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre.

Now that the gilded topaz egg has been presented to Nonotta and Riggy, the hunt has officially come to a close. You and Jihli are awarded the final pieces of this year's Hatching–tide costume, which the festival founder wastes no time in modeling, much to Nonotta's delight. She and Riggy have, through your efforts, proven that the conundrum they devised can indeed be solved by those with the necessary intellect and perseverance, with the next step being to allow the rest of the festival-goers to participate. Having partaken in this year's activities rather than organizing them herself, Jihli vows not to be outdone by her assistants when the next Hatching–tide arrives.
objectives: With the chat mode in Say, enter “Egg Hunt” in the correct location to discover the gilded topaz egg.
Deliver the gilded topaz egg to Nonotta at Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you choose to undertake this quest, know that guidance from the journal, duty list, and map will be limited. You will need to read the text carefully and decipher the clues to determine your course of action.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: All right, Nonotta. We shall have a look at this new map of yours.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I can barely see anything with all these letters in the way!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Hmm...I suppose this must be Old Gridania.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Is there any chance we could have some more hints this time?

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Haha! Not on your life, Jihli. In fact, you can have some extra spriggans instead!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: There are five in total, each with a different clue. And if you think it will be more or less the same as last time, you'd better think again!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Tricky, tricky, trickyyy!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Our last attempt to decipher their code went rather well, so perhaps we should stick to winning ways. If I look for hidden words on the map and you seek out those spriggans, the egg will be ours in a jiffy!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Jiffy, jiffy, jiffyyy!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Here's your map, Forename. I would wish you luck, but you'll need more than that to claim the prize!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Catchy egg! Hatchy egg!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Don't come to me looking for clues! I'm the last person who'll help you. Mwahahaha!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Use the crinkled cartograph and hints provided to discover the location of the gilded topaz egg.

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: Which one? Hee hee hee!

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: Nice two meet you!

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: No see forest! Only threes!

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: You look? What four?

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: Good to be a-five!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: There do not appear to be any significant differences between this map and the last, other than the location depicted and greatly increased number of letters. I think it is safe to say that the nature of the puzzle itself has not changed a great deal.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Found them already! My word, that was quick! Did they provide any useful clues?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: So they made a poor attempt at obfuscating their numbers this time? It seems their half-baked riddles were no match for your sleuthing skills.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, it seems we must face the true test... Now, let us piece together those clues and find the egg!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: You'll be needing the password too. This time it's “Eggceedingly Eggcellent and Eggsquisite Eggies!” ...Just kidding! It's “Egg Hunt” again.

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Say wordy, get eggy!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Use the information gleaned from the five spriggans and the clues on the map to determine the gilded topaz egg's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, enter “Egg Hunt” while standing in the correct location to discover the item.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you require further hints, speak with Jihli Aliapoh.

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: Which one? Hee hee hee!

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: Nice two meet you!

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: No see forest! Only threes!

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: You look? What four?

dialogue.name: SPRIGAN03204
dialogue.text: Five! Fiiive! Oh...forgot make riddle.

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: Thrice-cursed funguars! There's no end to them and their blasted, blighted spore─ Oh, pardon me, lasslad. Can I help you?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Egg Hunt

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: Egg hunt? What do you mean?

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: Ha! I've been waiting so long for you to show up, I'd almost forgotten about the password! So, I suppose you'll be wanting that funny-looking egg thing that's been rolling about and getting underfoot.

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: Pauline, Aldred, how about instead of standing there with your mouths open like a pair of hungry chicks, you go and check on that sickly beech tree?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I am glad I finally caught up with you, Forename! It seems your hunch was correct.

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: When your little friend in the silly hat and that lively spriggan came by and asked me to hold on to this egg, I didn't see any reason to refuse. But to be honest, I'll be glad to see the back of this thing, whichever side that is.

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Well done! Now you finally have your hands on the prize!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Friend find prize eggy! Riggy proud! Proooud!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I must say, you two are jolly clever for thinking up such a wonderful─not to mention difficult─game!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Riggy love egg hunt! Everyone play together!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: But egg hunt over now. Riggy sad...

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Oh, you poor thing...

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: You just wanted to be helpful, didn't you? And you have been! There must be some other way of assisting us, but what?

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: Well, if the lad's up to the task, I've a few odd jobs he can do around here.

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: I daresay an enterprising young spriggan like him knows a few things about rocks, soil, and whatnot that we woodsmen could put to good use.

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect! He's ever such a hard worker, you know.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: What do you think of that idea, Riggy?

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Riggy help! Helpy help help!

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: You'll get a fair day's wage for a fair day's work, the same as the rest of us.

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Riggy do best! Do best work!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I never expected that Riggy would go from hiding eggs to finding employment as a lumberjack's apprentice! While that was certainly not part of my dream, I think we can all agree it has led to a rather satisfying conclusion.

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Which reminds me, we should return to the amphitheatre and bring an official close to this year's egg hunt!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Riggy come back soon, gabby friend!

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: It's Gabineaux. Master Gabineaux, in fact, but that's only once you start working here. Anyway, enjoy the rest of your festival!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And I thought these puzzles could not possibly get any trickier...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Would you like Jihli to share her thoughts?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I wonder why there are so many more letters this time?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Could it be that there is an extra step or two involved?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Would you like Jihli to share more of her thoughts?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: If we start by using a similar technique to the previous puzzle, what do we get?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: It might even be more than just one word.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I wonder if this will lead to the answer or simply another clue?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Would you like Jihli to share yet more of her thoughts?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: This is clearly a lot more complex than the last conundrum.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Perhaps it would be easier if I marked the locations of the spriggans on the map?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: That's better!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Though obviously we still have to find the hidden word, or words, as the case may be.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Would you like Jihli to share even more of her thoughts?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: It seems the sensible thing to do is combine all the information we have at hand.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Goodness! It all looks rather messy, doesn't it?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Wait a moment... O, N, E, T, H, R, E, E, F, I, V, E?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: What a strange name! Hmm... Unless I am mistaken, that is not a name at all!

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: Would you like Jihli to all but solve the puzzle for you?

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Yes, this must be “one, three, five.”

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Hmm... Could that be it? Why, I believe I know someone in the Central Shroud by that name!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: You're not thinking about giving up, are you?

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Now that we're all back at the center of the Hatching–tide festivities, the time has come to officially present the gilded topaz egg!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: It is with great pleasure that I award you...the rest of your spriggan costume!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: You mean to say there are other garments to match this glorious jacket? I cannot wait to try them on!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Oh, Jihli! You were born to wear this sumptuous ensemble!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Long blue legs! Pretty like spriggan! Blue like...not spriggan! Riggy confused!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Oh, Riggy! You have a lot to learn about fashion, it seems!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: On the other hand, you could teach me a thing or two about creating games for Hatching–tide. The same goes for you, Nonotta!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: I'm glad all those evenings spent scratching our heads were not in vain.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And best of all, Riggy has found himself a job!

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Worky work work!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Of course, I would never have solved that conundrum all by myself. Thank you ever so much, Forename!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: It looks like I will have to try harder than ever to stand a chance of matching the spectacular efforts of these two geniuses! I hope you will join us for next year's Hatching–tide!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Now that Nonotta and Riggy have proved that the puzzle can indeed be solved─provided one possesses a certain degree of intelligence─we can allow the festival-goers to participate. I do hope our spriggan helpers do not mind remaining stationary for the time being...

dialogue.name: RIGGY
dialogue.text: Riggy make game! Riggy chop wood! Riggy helping!

dialogue.name: GABINEAUX
dialogue.text: I shall need to make a space for the boy to sleep. Do you happen to know what spriggans use for bedding? A carefully arranged pile of rocks or some such, I expect!
